summary:
Result-oriented software developer (Java/polyglot, focus on backend) and pragmatic analytical thinker with almost 25 years of experience in the field of IT. From writing high-quality code for big multinationals to managing a startup and C-level sparring partner for all things technological.

Passionate about creating beautiful software solutions, for people, with people.
Ambition to code, mentor, and lead by example.

Excellent autodidactic skills, I love to deep dive into R&D and create prototypes.

Comfortable communicating with people from different professional and cultural backgrounds, and discussing commercial benefits of technology with an entrepreneurial mindset.

Skills:
T-shaped developer with deep knowledge of back-end software engineering, architecture, and databases, whilst also having broad experience in front-end development, AWS/cloud, DevOps/infra, business analysis, leading teams, coaching, Scrum / process management, etc.

Main tools: 
Java, Spring Boot, Service-oriented architecture, JPA/Hibernate, Docker, REST APIs, Cloud (AWS), Databases (eg. MySQL, MongoDB)

Experience summary:
From 1997 until 2005 i worked for various employers on a permanent basis. From 2005 until present, i've been freelancing under my personal brand Codegap. From 2014 until 2019 Codegap partnered with GMS Group in a joint-venture in order to create CRM/loyalty software for the Marriott hotel-chain (a.o.), which was thereafter continued independently until 2021 as CRM-Loyalty. After doing some consultancy, small advisory projects, R&D of polyglot microservices and a well-timed sabbatical, early 2022 i joined Local Heroes as a backend developer. Within a few months i grew into the role of lead backend developer and mentor, and later CTO and advisor to the PO / scrum master.

certifications.name: Master Microservices with Spring Boot and Spring Cloud

profile_positions.description:
Deepening my knowledge on topics like event-based software architecture, microservice orchestration and choreography, containerisation, etc. The R&D is currently focussed on building a microservices-based e-commerce application, with each service implemented with a different stack like Spring Boot, Micronaut, Kotlin, Serverless with lambda's and Node.js

- Inventory Service: a REST API-only microservice that is compiled into a native application using GraalVM resulting in a huge performance gain on boot.
Tools, back-end: Java 11, Micronaut, Micronaut-data, REST API with URL-versioning, JPA, Hibernate, Flyway, JUnit 5 / Jupiter, GraalVM, Gradle, MySQL 8, Docker, Docker-compose, NGINX, Netty, Postman, Git, Bitbucket, IntelliJ.

- Customer Service: Full stack REST API microservice with a Vue.js frontend to manage the data.
Tools, back-end: Java 17, Spring Boot 2.5.4, Spring Data, Hibernate Validator, REST, MongoDB, Lombok, Flogger, JUnit 5, Mockito, Hamcrest, Docker, Docker-compose, Spring Boot Layertools (Docker image optimization), Maven, NGINX, Tomcat, Postman, Git, Bitbucket, IntelliJ.
Tools, front-end: Vue.js 3, Vue-router 4, Axios 0.21, Vuelidate 2, Oruga 0.5.2 (Toasts), Vue-fontawesome, Javascript ES6/ES2015, ESLint, NPM, Bootstrap 4.6, HTML, CSS, Docker, Visual Studio Code/VSCode.
profile_positions.title: R&D, study, prototyping & mini-projects

profile_positions.description: Providing on-demand technical, architectural and strategic advice to a promising undisclosed startup in the pedagogical / educational sector.
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Consultant

profile_positions.description:
- Various responsibilities like sparring partner of the CEO for all things IT-related (from strategic to implementation), preparing personal/professional growth paths for the IT employees, IT budget allocation, pitching to potential investors, and writing an alternative business plan for a possible pivot.
- Restructuring the agile processes during a time of change, and mentoring/coaching the new product owners / scrum masters.
profile_positions.title: CTO

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for the backend of the Local Heroes application stack: designing and implementing new features and improvements (often combined with huge refactorings of legacy code), whilst maintaining stability by fixing bugs, formalizing API specifications and various DevOps tasks. 
- Supported and adviced the product owner and scrummaster on streamlining the agile processes, for example a transformation from Kanban to Scrum, feature/bug prioritization, sprint planning, etc.
- Mentored other developers in the neverending strive for better, cleaner code.
- Enabled the marketing department to automate their retention funnel by creating an event-driven, system-wide framework that integrates with and feeds sliced data into Leanplum, a leading 3rd-party customer engagement platform.
- Achieved a significant improvement in both hit-rates and performance of the in-app search engine by replacing the legacy in-house software with a module that integrates with Typesense, a fast cloud-based solution.
- FinOps: achieved significant cost-savings by tailoring and restructuring AWS cloud usage.

Tools: PHP, Symphony, CakePHP, MySQL 5.7 / 8, Twig, Bootstrap, OpenAPI, Docker / Docker Compose, Heroku, Git/Github, Amazon AWS EC2 / RDS / S3, Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment (CI/CD), Leanplum, Typesense, Jekyll, Cloudflare, CloudImage, Visual Studio Code / VSCode, Android Studio, Slack, Discord, Notion, Trello
profile_positions.title: Lead backend developer & Advisor to the Scrummaster and Product Owner

profile_positions.description:
Analysis, requirement gathering and development of a microservice-oriented proof of concept application for a client in the catering industry.

Tools: Java, Spring Boot, REST, MongoDB, Docker, Docker-compose.
profile_positions.title: Senior Developer / Business Analyst / Entrepreneur

profile_positions.description:
Adding new features to the micro(/mini)services-based CRM / Loyalty software i build for GMS-IT, such as customer behavior prediction algorithms, fine-grained information filtering and RFM (recency/frequency/monetary) transaction analysis, visually appealing graphical dashboards, profile tagging, a full on marketing-campaign module, and tight integration with the Mailchimp subscriber-cycle for full AVG/GDPR compliance.

Tools: Java, microservices, Spring Boot, Groovy, Grails, REST API, Cloud deployment, Amazon AWS (EC2 / EBS / RDS / Lambda / S3 / IAM / SES / SQS), Hibernate, AngularJS, Bootstrap, Google Charts, JasperReports, Quartz, SQL/ stored procedures, MySQL, Liquibase, CD/CI with Jenkins, Git, BitBucket, Let's Encrypt SSL, Tomcat, Jetty, Mailchimp, Twilio, Trello, IntelliJ, SequalPro, Postman.
profile_positions.title: Senior Developer / Software Architect / Entrepreneur

profile_positions.description:
In partnership with GMS Group, the largest provider of customized F&B loyalty programs for the hotel industry in Asia-Pacific, our start-up GMS-IT developed the CRM and financial reporting technology GMS Group (a.o) needed to manage their F&B programs.

- Clients: Marriott / Starwood / Hyatt / Jumeirah Hotels & Resorts

- Creating and implementing strategy and business plans, C-level business analysis, and day-to-day management including financials and HR.
- Managing, hiring, coaching and educating international development teams
- Agile development process implementor and coach

- Responsible for all things technological: strategy, application and system architecture, both front- and back-end development, data analysis, database engineering, code reviews, prototyping, testing, infrastructure setup, DevOps, etc.

- Software: a microservice- (or rather miniservice-) based SaaS application that consisted of a scalable, stateless and session-less back-end running in the cloud (AWS). It featured a well documented REST API, exposed via a secure custom API gateway as the single entry point for the independently deployable AngularJS front-end, a Drupal CMS, various mobile apps and WeChat. It also included an advanced connectivity API communicating with various Point-of-Sale (POS) systems for realtime revenue reporting and drill-down viewing of transaction data.

Tools: Java, microservices, Spring Boot, Groovy, Grails, REST API, Cloud deployment, Amazon AWS (EC2 / EBS / RDS / Lambda / S3 / IAM / SES / SQS), Hibernate, AngularJS, Bootstrap, Google Charts, JasperReports, Quartz, SQL/stored procedures, MySQL, Liquibase, CD/CI with Jenkins, Git, BitBucket, Let's Encrypt SSL, Tomcat, Jetty, Mailchimp, Twilio, IntelliJ, SequalPro, Postman, Jira, Trello
profile_positions.title: CTO / Managing Partner / Entrepreneur / Senior Developer

profile_positions.description:
GMS provides loyalty marketing and logistics solutions to over 200 four and five star hotels in the Asia Pacific region.
My activities included restructuring the client's IT department (both organisation and HR), interviews/hiring and performance evaluations, transitioning the client's in-house data centre to an AWS cloud environment, design and implement strong backup & recovery plans, reviewing and revising their legacy software portfolio, and putting processes in place for documenting / safeguarding business knowledge.
profile_positions.title: IT Special Projects

profile_positions.description:
Design and implementation of the new KLM OpenAPI / REST microservice-based architecture.
Development of Productshop, a central subsystem of the KLM planning & booking applications.

Tools: Java 7, Groovy, Spring 3, Spring Web Flow, Spring MVC, Spring Test/MockMVC, REST, JAX-RS, JSON, HATEOAS, Hypermedia, RESTful architecture, Web API Design, OpenAPI, AngularJS, Lo-Dash,  Infinispan, Hazelcast, Webservices, JAX-WS, XSD, SOAP, Metro, JAXB, Dozer, JPA, Hibernate, JUnit, Mockito, PowerMock, JsonPath, Hamcrest, TDD, Checkstyle, EclEmma, Selenium, Oracle, Spring Tools Suite (STS / Eclipse), SoapUI, Tomcat 7, Maven, Cloudfoundry, Git, Stash, JIRA, Bamboo, Sonar, Confluence, FishEye
profile_positions.title: Senior Java Developer

profile_positions.description: Wholistic review of the quality of software, software architecture, and development processes that are used at the GMS Group, an Asian marketleader in loyalty programmes, logistics and technology. This also included advise on organisational structure, project management, best practices for development, technology stacks, and an introduction to agile (Scrum/Kanban) processes.
profile_positions.title: Technical Consultant / Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Researching and developing prototypes for a mobile publishing platform (both front- and backend) for a collective of writers and game-developers.

Tools: Spring Boot, Spring Data, JPA, Hibernate, Maven, Groovy, Grails, REST, JSON, MySQL, AppGyver Steroids, Appery.io, Ratchet, HTML5, CSS3, AJAX, JQuery, JQuery Mobile, Hammer.js, Topcoat, Bootstrap, Font-awesome, Bower, Placehold.it, BEM CSS notation, Pancake.io, Strikingly, iOS Simulator, Eclipse Kepler, Git, GitHub
